items.sentence: I can\'t guarantee we\'ll be able to get the job done by next Monday.
The coat Tom wanted was too expensive. That\'s why he didn\'t buy it.
You should avoid Tom today if at all possible. He\'s very mad at you.
All Tom wanted was for Mary to play a couple of tunes on her ukulele.
Can I have those broken pieces of china that are out in the woodshed?
Tom is the only man in the world that is likely to break that record.
Tom won\'t be able to tell you anything that you don\'t already know.
I\'m sorry that I didn\'t have the opportunity to say goodbye to Tom.
I have trouble falling asleep because I always have a lot on my mind.
A bucket list is a list of things that you want to do before you die.
How much time do you think it would take to ride a bicycle to Boston?
I didn\'t know you were sick, so I didn\'t visit you in the hospital.
Tom is going to buy a necklace for Mary with the money John gave him.
The real problem is that you don\'t even know that we have a problem.
Tom knew I\'d be asleep at 2:30 in the morning, but he called anyway.
Police officers installed surveillance cameras outside Tom\'s office.
Tom and Mary wanted to get married and have kids as soon as possible.
Tom and his friends sat around the campfire and roasted marshmallows.
Tom wouldn\'t just leave like that. He\'d have at least said goodbye.
I don\'t know when he\'ll come, but when he does, he\'ll do his best.
Tom wants to call his uncle, but he can\'t seem to get a hold of him.
Tom went upstairs with Mary and sat by her bed until she fell asleep.
Tom doesn\'t like swimming in this river. He says it\'s too polluted.
Tom appreciated all the letters Mary sent him while he was in prison.
Tom now has enough money to buy the guitar he\'s been wanting to buy.
Tom probably won\'t live long enough to see his daughter get married.
It looks like it might rain, so you should take an umbrella with you.
Tom wasn\'t surprised that Mary already knew about what had happened.
I wonder whether or not there\'s any cheese left in the refrigerator.
Tom tried to persuade his parents to let him go to Boston by himself.
You have to promise never to tell anyone what I\'m about to tell you.
Tom asked me to tell you he didn\'t plan on going to Boston with you.
Tom decided to step back and allow Mary to handle things for a while.
I\'m surprised that you didn\'t know that Tom couldn\'t speak French.
You should probably not tell Tom that you don\'t know how to do that.
Apparently, Tom was late because there was a traffic jam on Route 19.
I wasn\'t able to sing very well tonight because I had a sore throat.
We don\'t need any more volunteers, but we could use some more money.
Tom couldn\'t shake the feeling that he\'d met Mary somewhere before.
Some of the trees in our neighborhood were knocked down by the storm.
Did anyone tell Tom and Mary what time they were supposed to be here?
How can I finish my homework when I have to help you clean the house?
Tom had a life insurance policy worth three hundred thousand dollars.
Tom had to wait on Mary hand and foot after her ankle reconstruction.
Tom has been living in the woods by himself for the last three years.
Tom apparently hasn\'t yet told Mary that he\'s not going to do that.
Tom has never been to Boston before, so I offered to show him around.
Tom is fishing for trout about a hundred meters downstream from here.
The front door of Tom\'s house was locked, but the back door wasn\'t.
Where were you when you realized that you didn\'t have your umbrella?
